It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
